item.title: Accountant or accounts clerk, which one for your startup?
item.description: The short answer is both! Why? An accountant1 is needed to lay the correct and proper foundation whereas an accounts clerk is needed (assuming you have reasonable amount of transactions) to keep the books in orderly manner. Accounts clerk may also double as your payroll and admin clerk. Note that, if you are on a strict budget, you can do many things yourself if your books are properly set up. You just need a review every 6 months or annually by your accountant.
